intro: Talisia subalbens, commonly known as the silverleaf talisia, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its broad, silver-gray leaves that are covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. It produces small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters during the warmer months. Talisia subalbens is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
